barely.translation[0].definitions[0].def: only with great difficulty or effort
barely.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She was very old and barely able to walk.
Mary had barely enough money to live on.
barely.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: She was barely aware of his presence.
Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
barely.translation[0].definitions[2].def: used to emphasize that something happens immediately after a previous action
barely.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Graham had barely finished his coffee when Henry returned.
barely.translation[0].definitions[3].def: used before amounts or numbers to emphasize that they are surprisingly small
barely.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Nowadays, the village has barely 100 inhabitants.
